DATA.description: Creates a new data table from external files or existing tables.

PROC SORT.description: Sorts a data table by the values of one or more variables.
PROC SORT.example: PROC SORT DATA = USERS_1964; BY LASTNAME; RUN;

MERGE.description: Reads simultaneously several input tables (join of tables).

SET.description: Concatenates multiple tables by reading all lines into the output table.

OUTPUT.description: Reads lines from existing tables into the output table, can filter or rename.

PROC PRINT.description: Prints an eFront Report data table using specified variables.
PROC PRINT.example: PROC PRINT DATA=USERS_1964; VAR NAME AGE; RUN;

RUN.description: Ends and executes the current step.
